section.para: Instead of repeatedly defining similar styles for each report, you can define a style in the styles library and reuse it in other reports. To achieve this you can use a style template (called also Styles Library in iReport), which is a container where one or more styles are stored. In this container there must be only styles.
From JasperSoft Studio open the menu File->New->Style Template File

figure.title: Select the action to create a new styles template

section.para: Now select the folder in your workspace where to put the template file and the name of the file. Then hit Finish.
Now a new style template will be created, with already a style in it. At this point you can create new styles by right clicking on the Styles node, into the Outline view, and select "Create Style".

figure.title: Add another styles to the template

section.para: To edit a style simply select it and edit its properties from the property tab, like you do in a normal report.
